title: Chinese Embassy provides tractors and other agricultural equipment to Multi-Agricultural Bureau of Togo in January 2020 (linked to project #87088)
description: On January 6, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided tractors and other agricultural development materials to the Agricultural Bureau of Togo. This donation was made immediately after the inauguration ceremony for the Kara Youth Center in Togo that was funded and built by the Chinese Embassy and China Road and Bridge Corporation. The agricultural donation appears to have no connection to the Youth Center other than the delivery taking place after the inauguration ceremony. The agricultural materials will be used to improve agricultural development in Togo and strengthen cooperation in the agricultural field between China and Togo. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation after the inauguration ceremony of the Kara Youth Center. China’s Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidong, and the Governor of Koza Province in Togo attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides tractors and other agricultural equipment to Multi-Agricultural Bureau of Togo in January 2020 (linked to project #87088)

# Description
On January 6, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided tractors and other agricultural development materials to the Agricultural Bureau of Togo. This donation was made immediately after the inauguration ceremony for the Kara Youth Center in Togo that was funded and built by the Chinese Embassy and China Road and Bridge Corporation. The agricultural donation appears to have no connection to the Youth Center other than the delivery taking place after the inauguration ceremony. The agricultural materials will be used to improve agricultural development in Togo and strengthen cooperation in the agricultural field between China and Togo. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation after the inauguration ceremony of the Kara Youth Center. China’s Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidong, and the Governor of Koza Province in Togo attended the ceremony and delivered speeches.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural development aid without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of tractors and agricultural equipment, focus on agricultural development in Togo

title: China begins seventh phase of agricultural technical assistance project to Togo (Linked to Project ID#87719)
description: In July 2020 , China provided the seventh agricultural technical assistance project team to Togo. The team established a technical exchange group in the Kara region of Togo through the social media platform WhatsApp. This exchange group will be used to exchange experience on rice, corn cultivation, and pest control. The group will also guide local farmers in agricultural production. The project team originally intended to have on-site technical guidance, but due to the pandemic, they were forced to do online consultation.  There are 22 members in the group, including eight local technicians from the Institute of Agricultural Sciences, eight technical extension staff, and six farmers. Each multi-party technician in the exchange group is responsible for 5-10 farmers. As of July 29th, 2020, the project team tested and demonstrated hybrid rice planting in the Kara area, and the yield increased by as much as 60%. The successful experiment and demonstration of dry season rice planting by Chinese experts has led to the Togolese government successively introducing a series of measures to develop agriculture, intending to promote the results of the project on a larger scale.  On April 21, 2020, Bei Leiyi, the director of the Kara Agriculture Bureau, led the deputy director of the Agriculture Bureau and related technical personnel to visit the red tide rice demonstration base. The technical assistance project will allow Togo to plant rice during the dry season, therefore boosting agricultural output. The Agricultural Technology Group also planted hybrid corn, which contains disease resistance, lodging resistance, and suitability for mechanical operation. As revealed by an interview with Togo News on November 5, 2020, the locally promoted varieties of corn and rice increased production by more than 30%.   This is the seventh phase of agricultural technical assistance provided to Togo by the Chinese government. Details on the sixth phase of assistance is found in Project ID#87719.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title

# Description
In July 2020 , China provided the seventh agricultural technical assistance project team to Togo. The team established a technical exchange group in the Kara region of Togo through the social media platform WhatsApp. This exchange group will be used to exchange experience on rice, corn cultivation, and pest control. The group will also guide local farmers in agricultural production. The project team originally intended to have on-site technical guidance, but due to the pandemic, they were forced to do online consultation.  There are 22 members in the group, including eight local technicians from the Institute of Agricultural Sciences, eight technical extension staff, and six farmers. Each multi-party technician in the exchange group is responsible for 5-10 farmers. As of July 29th, 2020, the project team tested and demonstrated hybrid rice planting in the Kara area, and the yield increased by as much as 60%. The successful experiment and demonstration of dry season rice planting by Chinese experts has led to the Togolese government successively introducing a series of measures to develop agriculture, intending to promote the results of the project on a larger scale.  On April 21, 2020, Bei Leiyi, the director of the Kara Agriculture Bureau, led the deputy director of the Agriculture Bureau and related technical personnel to visit the red tide rice demonstration base. As revealed by an interview with Togo News on November 5, 2020, the locally promoted varieties of corn and rice increased production by more than 30%. justification: Project focuses on agricultural technical assistance and knowledge transfer without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural technical assistance, knowledge sharing through WhatsApp group, focus on rice and corn cultivation techniques

title: China and Togo sign exchange of letters for the overhaul of the Presidential Palace project in Togo
description: On January 14 and 17, 2020, China’s Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidong, and Director of the Office of the President of the Togolese Republic, Victoire Tomega-Dobe, signed an agreement for the exchange of letters for the overhaul project of the Presidential Palace in Togo. This signing took place in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Exact details about the project, including what parts of the palace will be overhauled, were not specified. The financing details of this project are also unavailable.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China and Togo sign exchange of letters for the overhaul of the Presidential Palace project in Togo

# Description
On January 14 and 17, 2020, China’s Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidong, and Director of the Office of the President of the Togolese Republic, Victoire Tomega-Dobe, signed an agreement for the exchange of letters for the overhaul project of the Presidential Palace in Togo. This signing took place in Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Exact details about the project, including what parts of the palace will be overhauled, were not specified. The financing details of this project are also unavailable.
justification: Project involves government building renovation with no clear environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Overhaul of Presidential Palace, no specified environmental or energy-related components

title: Chinese Embassy provides supplies to the Togo Advisory Council on Senior Citizens Affairs in October 2020
description: On October 15, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided supplies to the Togo Senior Citizens Advisory Council.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation on October 15, 2020. Chao Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to Togo, Minister of Multi-Social Action, Women's Promotion and Literacy, Arpedo-Anakoma, the Chief of Staff, the Secretary-General, the Director of the National Rescue Agency, and the Coordinator of Togo's Advisory Council for the Elderly Affairs, Ajay Wei-Nelope, attended the ceremony. In his speech at the handover ceremony, Ambassador Chao stated that this donation of charitable materials to the Togo Senior Citizen Affairs Advisory Council reflects China’s respect for the elderly.   The specific content of this donation is unknown. Official sources reported the content as “charitable materials” but the specifics are unavailable. The monetary value of this donation is also unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
UNALLOCATED/UNSPECIFIED

# Title
Chinese Embassy provides supplies to the Togo Advisory Council on Senior Citizens Affairs in October 2020

# Description
On October 15, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided supplies to the Togo Senior Citizens Advisory Council.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation on October 15, 2020. Chao Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to Togo, Minister of Multi-Social Action, Women's Promotion and Literacy, Arpedo-Anakoma, the Chief of Staff, the Secretary-General, the Director of the National Rescue Agency, and the Coordinator of Togo's Advisory Council for the Elderly Affairs, Ajay Wei-Nelope, attended the ceremony. In his speech at the handover ceremony, Ambassador Chao stated that this donation of charitable materials to the Togo Senior Citizen Affairs Advisory Council reflects China’s respect for the elderly.   The specific content of this donation is unknown. Official sources reported the content as “charitable materials” but the specifics are unavailable. The monetary value of this donation is also unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of unspecified charitable materials to support senior citizens, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of charitable materials to Togo Senior Citizens Advisory Council, focus on social welfare and respect for elderly

title: Chinese Embassy donates daily necessities to Togo in June 2020
description: On June 18, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided charitable materials to the Togo National Basic Development Assistance Agency. The materials included grain, oil, and other daily necessities. These materials will be distributed to families that have been severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation on June 18, 2020. China’s Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidong, the Director of the Togo National Basic Development Assistance Agency, and Wo Wo, the Director of the General Office of the Ministry of Basic Development, Handicrafts and Youth of Togo, attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese Embassy provides anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Development, Planning and Cooperation of Togo in May 2020
description: On May 20, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided anti-epidemic materials to the Ministry of Development, Planning and Cooperation of Togo. These materials will be used to make medical masks which will relieve the mask shortage in Togo. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation on May 20, 2020. The Chinese Ambassador to Togo, Chao Weidon, and the Director of the General Office of Togo's Ministry of Development, Planning and Cooperation attended the ceremony.

title: Chinese medical team provides anti-epidemic materials to National Assembly of Togo in December 2020
description: On December 9, 2020, the 23rd Chinese medical team in Togo provided anti-epidemic materials to the National Assembly of Togo. The materials included masks, hand sanitizer, disinfectants and a batch of commonly used medicines (anti-malarial, anti-cold, fever reduction, pain relief, various vitamins, etc.). The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation immediately after a meeting between Chao Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to Togo, and Cai Gang, the Speaker of the Togo National Assembly, on December 9, 2020. At this meeting, the two exchanged views on the development of China-Togo relations. At the ceremony, the Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly and the Director of the Speaker's Office received the medical team's donation on behalf of the Speaker of the National Assembly.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese medical team provides anti-epidemic materials to National Assembly of Togo in December 2020

# Description
On December 9, 2020, the 23rd Chinese medical team in Togo provided anti-epidemic materials to the National Assembly of Togo. The materials included masks, hand sanitizer, disinfectants and a batch of commonly used medicines (anti-malarial, anti-cold, fever reduction, pain relief, various vitamins, etc.). The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation immediately after a meeting between Chao Weidong, the Chinese Ambassador to Togo, and Cai Gang, the Speaker of the Togo National Assembly, on December 9, 2020. At this meeting, the two exchanged views on the development of China-Togo relations. At the ceremony, the Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly and the Director of the Speaker's Office received the medical team's donation on behalf of the Speaker of the National Assembly.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Anti-epidemic materials including masks, hand sanitizer, disinfectants, and medicines

title: China Civil Aviation Airport Construction Group Co., Ltd. provides anti-epidemic materials to Togo in May 2020
description: On May 26, 2020, China Civil Aviation Airport Construction Group Co., Ltd. provided anti-epidemic materials to Togo. The materials included 100,000 masks, charcoal, and other urgently needed anti-epidemic materials. These masks will be used to improve COVID-19 prevention efforts in Togo. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation on May 26, 2020. The Management Committee of New Crown Virus Epidemic Prevention Materials and Sanitary Equipment of the Presidential Palace of Togo received the batch of materials on behalf of the Togolese government.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Beijing Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. provides anti-epidemic materials to Togo in July 2020
description: On July 1, 2020, Beijing Construction Engineering Group Co., Ltd. provided anti-epidemic materials to the Presidential Palace of Togo and the Lomé Regional Central Hospital. The materials included 10,000 medical surgical masks, 500 kilograms of rice and 20 boxes of mineral water. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony took place for this donation on July 1, 2020. Ma Wei, the representative of Lomé Regional Central Hospital, attended the handover ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: China Shenyang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co., Ltd. provides anti-epidemic materials to Togo in May 2020
description: On May 12, 2020, China Shenyang International Economic and Technological Cooperation Co., Ltd. provided anti-epidemic materials to Toga Cara Regional Central Hospital. The materials included 500 liters of 75% medical alcohol. These materials will be used to support Togo's anti-epidemic efforts The exact monetary value of this donation is unknown.   The president of Togo Cala Regional Central Hospital wrote to the Chinese Embassy in Togo and China Shenyang International Economic and Technical Cooperation Co., Ltd. to thank them for the donation.
